comm with chicken and dumplings that's

so if you can simmer it you can make a

so I'm going to do basically a chicken
stew although it's much more like a soup
consistency than a thick thick stew and
we'll talk about that later but I'm
going to put a whole chicken in a Dutch
oven it's about four pounds I'm gonna
throw in some mirepoix that's fancy
French for celery carrots onions I just
diced them up I'm gonna throw in a
couple quarts of cold water I'm gonna
toss in a bay leaf and a little bit of

at this point I'm gonna put the heat on
high and bring that up to a boil and as
soon as that starts boiling I'm gonna
back the heat down to very low I just
want a very gentle simmer at that point
we're going to cover this and cook it
for one hour
after an hour I'm going to take the
chicken out put it in a bowl to cool
because we're gonna want to pick all the
meat off the chicken so set that aside
alright and while that's cooling we're
going to go ahead and turn the heat back
to high on our stock it's going to come
to a boil and then I want you to take a
ladle and skim off about two tablespoons
of that chicken fat alright and we're
going to use that to make something
similar to a roux so I'm gonna take a
couple tablespoons of that chicken fat
I'm going to stir in about an equal
amount of flour just to make sort of a
paste consistency when that's stirred
together I'm going to take a couple

stir that in just give it a stir it's
going to start to thicken up and at that

whisk it in that little steps kind of
optional but I think it helps to prevent

little bit of flour to really thicken

little extra body and to introduce a
little bit of that chicken fat flavor
into our chicken and dumplings okay so
once that's been mixed in I want you to

15 minutes which is going to be the

should be cool enough for us to handle
if it's not just wait alright so I
picked all the chicken
off the bone every scrap we're going to
